result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elmo Jerome Peyton III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton III not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Elmo Jerome Peyton III.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has an open felony case the State is moving to join. Case is adjourned to 11-7-22 at 8:30 am for status conference, by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Due to defendant's pending felony matters, case is reassigned to Judge Havas. Pre-trial conference on 10/27/22 moved to 10/24 at 8:30 am to follow along with defendant's pending felony matters in Branch 10.

Court ordered no contact with Shaquita A. M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Elmo Jerome Peyton III appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason A Findling appeared by video for Elmo Jerome Peyton III.  Attorney John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
